about.name: Abrar Jalal
about.title: Undergraduate Student at Boston College
about.description: Abrar Jalal is currently an undergraduate student at Boston College in the Morrissey College of Arts & Science. He is currently pursuing a bachelors of science, majoring in Computer Science and minoring in Mathematics. He is an active member in Boston College's Computer Science Society and Running Club.

news.title: Visited family and vacationed in Bangladesh.
Joined Boston College's Computer Science Society.
Joined Boston College's Club Running team.
Selected into Boston College Computer Science Society's Mentorship Program.
Began working at The Market at Corcoran Commons for work study.

projects.title: 'No More Monster Here' Stage Design Collaboration Project
projects.source: Stage Design I, Professor Crystal Tiala, Spring 2020
projects.description: In this project for my stage design class my group and I have developed a script breakdown for the play 'No More Monsters Here' by Marcus Gardley. We have conducted visual and thematic research for this play by creating a pinterest board and exploring unqiue and creative approaches to stage design.
projects.summary: For our final design we have decided to go with a surrealistic approach to the set design. This entails a more dream like effect on our play. We hope to acheive this with a pixelated videogame-like backdrop and exaggerated actions.

projects.title: Bulls and Cows Game
projects.description: In this project for my Data Structures course at Boston College I created a user-based game called 'Bulls and Cows' using Java. The presmise of the game is to discover what the randomly generated computer number is with 10 guesses. The only aide recived is a Bulls indicator (which means right digit and right placeholder) or Cows indicator (which means right digit wrong placeholder).
projects.summary: In the intitial stages of this game I had kept the size of the random integer fixed to 4 digits, however, since then I have added levels to the game and added more digits. Ultimately, the goal was to make it harder for the user to win as he or she progressed through the levels.

projects.title: Portfolio Project
projects.source: Web Development, Nam Wook Kim Spring 2020
projects.description: In this project for my Web development course I applied many of the skills and lessons I learned from class to create my own portfolio website. I used HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to develop this website.Web Development
projects.summary: In this project for my Web development course I applied many of the skills and lessons I learned from class to create my own portfolio website. I am using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to develop this website.
